result.execSummary:
The defendant Leia M. Cruz-Perez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department. - Stayed
Consecutive to: to 15CM62

miscConds.notes: Pay fine/costs and DNA surcharge. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Comply with same conditions as stated in 15CM62.

records.addlTxt:
10.18 a.m. Defendant Leia M. Cruz-Perez in court with attorney Michael Daniel Zell. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
14CM502 to be DRI
15CM62: I/S Sentence: 30 days jail-stay, 12 mo Probation: Pay costs.
15CM63: I/S Sentence: 30 days jail-stay, consecutive, 12 mo Probation: $100 + costs,   AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.   Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.   Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases. Disclose any prescriptions prescribed to agent immediately.   Engage and comply in any other counseling as recommended by the Agent.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CM62 and 15CM63 - Guilty

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CM62 and 15CM63.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
 14CM502 and Uncharged Bail Jump on 05-18-15 are Dismissed and Read In.

DA Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Zell concurs with agreement and requests jail be concurrent.
Court questions the Defendant.

BY THE COURT:*******PROBATION**********
15CM62: I/S Sentence: 30 days jail-stay, Huber, if approved by jail adminstration.
12 mo Probation: Pay costs+DNA surcharge.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.   
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.   
Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescription drug use and have access to pharmacy drug records and treating physician to determine compliance. Disclose any prescriptions prescribed to agent immediately.
Engage and comply in any other counseling as recommended by the Agent.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
  

15CM63: I/S Sentence: 30 days jail, Huber, if approved by the jail-stay, consecutive, 12 mo Probation, concurrent: 
Comply with all conditions in the 15CM62.  
Pay $100 fine + costs + DNA Surcharge.
from Atty Zell - request for appointment on 15CM63 and 15CM62. (original filed in 15CM62).
granted: reimbursement for court appointment of Attorney Zell (added 15CM63 and 15CM62 to 11-24-14 paperwork)
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

All files heard: 14CM502 (Status), 15CM62, 15CM63

  Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaints.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
